BTW how train my kerbonuats

You can have more than command one pod on one rocket, or research pods that hold more than one kerbal. Then you can have Jeb or Val take the driver's seat while Bill comes along for the ride. He will get the experience even if he does nothing during the flight. You could also research probe cores with pilot abilities and use those, but they come later in the tech tree than the first passenger pod, Mk1 Crew Cabin.

To train your kerbonauts you take them around the solar system. There was a thread about the most efficient training regiment somewhere. I forget the details, but I am sure planting flags on Mun and Minmus and visiting interplanetary space for a moment was more than enough to get five stars.
IIRC The training program is: Orbit the Mun, plant a flag on Minmus, then pop into solar orbit then land back on Kerbin. Good for 3 stars.
This thread is more of a Gameplay Question about how to train kerbals, moved.

You don't need to go to orbit or extremely high. Build a really small rocket that'll only get you to to that altitude with that speed, cut the engines and deploy the chutes. Keep it cheap because those part tests don't pay that well. And attach the chutes with the symmetry tool or they will try to flip your rocket during ascent.
